website_summaries.verdict: Packing near-RTX 2080 performance and similar specs, Nvidia's GeForce RTX 2070 Super rules for solid 4K play at 60Hz and high-refresh gameplay at 1440p. It's a killer card for the money.
pros: Stable overclocking results help it rival original RTX 2080
RT and Tensor cores ensure future-proofing

customer_reviews.title: Good card
customer_reviews.text: The card is good and I have no problems with it. However please note that registering it with MSI requires a CHK number off the card itself so get this before you install into the the comp
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pure power
customer_reviews.text: Runs overwatch and destiny 2 in 4k like it's nothing, and seeing as its only 5% slower (but with better tech) than the 2080, and up to 200 cheaper. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Juman

customer_reviews.title: Don't cheap out and buy a better card
customer_reviews.text: Performance is like a reference nvidia card, however, this card is noisy and with a poor design. MSI cooling solution for a 2070 Super is not great and they did a poor job with mounting the cooler to the board (RAM chips have very thick and small thermal pads and thermal compound used on the die is closer to toothpaste that a decent compound). And since this card doesn't offer any official power overhead, overclocking it is very difficult. To sum it all up, don't buy this card, there are better options, that are cooler and quieter at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mantas Simonaitis

customer_reviews.title: Great Card Delivers what it says
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I opted for the Gigabyte 5700xt. MISTAKE. Cheaper and totally unreliable as a web search will find you many many others having lots of very bad problems with this and other AMD cards. Returned the same to Amazon who issued a direct refund. Got this card with free Call of Duty codes and it just simply works very very well and reliably. Card runs everything well at 1440 and runs fairly cool even with non aggressive fan curve. Would not hesitate to say this card is GREAT. It also delivered at least 15-25% better benchmark scores than the 5700XT. So for me Nvidia all the way
customer_reviews.author: Mr. MD

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is Good enough for gaming, it can be overclocked a bit the only thing I don't like about it which I just noticed is it seems to have half of the chip surface covered by thermal pads like one of the other cards gamer's nexus had a video about. You can see it from the side, no need to disassemble it. I am guessing if proper ones applied it will perform even better. Minus 1 star for that. Overall for the price it is a very good choice, especially just for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: IOANNIS A.

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but loud and high temperatures
customer_reviews.text: This card has good performance in games however the cooling system lets this card down massively. While playing games, the fans are extremely loud and I can hear them over my headset. Temperatures were usually in the 85C range which is fine but I prefer to sit a bit lower than that. The card I also received had bad coil whine which was very audible over the headset too. I returned the card about a month after buying it and replaced it with a different card which was much quieter, cooler and had no coil whine. I would recommend paying the extra £20-50 for a different card.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Maskell

customer_reviews.title: League of it's own!
customer_reviews.text: Kinda on the heavy side compared to my old GTX 970 but worth the purchase (for now). However, this card is quiet and plays most of my games on the highest quality in 1440p without going below 75fps, besides Ark Survival (poorly optimised game). Would I recommend this for those looking to buy in early 2020? Yep, definitely. This card is a league of its own when gaming compared to my old GTX.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Good GPU
customer_reviews.text: It's a great GPU. I can run anything I want with it. The fans of this model are a bit loud as the other reviews say, but it really isn't that bothersome. If you wear headphones, its no problem. If a PS4 isn't too loud for you, this certainly also isn't.
customer_reviews.author: 匿名

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The card died while playing Half Life: Alyx only 6 months after purchase. Don't waste your time with this poorly designed product. Also the MSI RMA service is extremely tedious to use and their broken website doesn't even allow me to submit a ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent GPU
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this card. It was the best value RTX 2070 Super available at the time & it doesn't disappoint. Nice & quiet too. GPU's are completely overpriced these days, it's hard finding one that's even remotely decent value. At the time of purchase the RTX 2070 Super seemed to hit the sweet spot for top performance & value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've paired this card with a 10 yr old 1st gen LGA-1366 Xeon CPU (W3690 = i7-990X) and due to the card's simple build, design and mechanics it works wonders with my rig. The lack of LED's installed on the card mean it does not hog the CPU utilization as other variants of the same model do (as previously tested by myself) unless you have more up to date components of course. Handles any game (only tested 1080/1440p) I've thrown at it in max settings without breaking a sweat and is absolutely quiet. Get it if you have no plans of moving away from LGA-1366 tech. My MB is a Rampage III Extreme from 2011.
customer_reviews.author: Yemi

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Loud And Hot
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, looks good, performance great, but when you make use of the card to its full potential, runs very hot, fans are loud trying to cool it and some coil whine. Had to keep side of my case to keep under 75c and I'm water cooled so not optimum for other components.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tubman

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I can run the witcher, 4k ultra at 50 fps, no stuttering. Says it all really. Only downside is fans are loud, but can turn them down in Afterburner, or wear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality vs price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great card, bought it for gpu rendering and occasional gaming. The only thing is as PC is turned on, gpu fams are spinning at max for 20 second, and only then PC start to initialize, anyone knows how to disable it ? ))
customer_reviews.author: polyx

customer_reviews.title: Great card for the price. +++
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card as it was reviewed in the top 5 cards on comparison websites. Decent price for the quality as I didn’t want to spend £1k on a card. Installed by a pro installer and gives good FPS even When not over locked which I will do when I get around to it. Recommended +++
customer_reviews.author: mr s.

customer_reviews.title: Beefy GPU that's worth the price
customer_reviews.text: An amazing graphics card. I bought this to replace my AMD Radeon R9 290X which was struggling to run games on higher settings, but this 2070 has made my gaming experiences so much better. I love GeForce Experience, especially the Shadowplay feature so that I can record gameplay from the last few minutes in case something cool happened while I wasn't already recording. Every game I've played so far (including Rainbow Six Siege and Destiny 2) have ran perfectly, and I've not found any faults yet. The 2070 itself also looks pretty cool inside my PC, as seen in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Powerful card that with an automatic overclock via the msi afterburner software it's just behind a stock rtx2080 for far less money, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing card. If your looking to build a higher end gaming system. It’s such great value for money if your looking at playing high FPS heavy games and it stays super cool as well
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Best budget graphic for sure
customer_reviews.text: I built my own pc for the first time and i was looking for a pc for years, 2080/2080ti too expensive, so i choose this one, very new graphic, super fast and great with i7 9700k, easy to install and good looking
customer_reviews.author: Vitor Lemos

customer_reviews.title: Really Fast!
customer_reviews.text: My personal experience is from a GTX970 to RTX 2070 SUPER...another world :)
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great card. Great performance overall. Some coil whine heard when fans hit 80% and above.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Box already opened? Refund!
customer_reviews.text: Box came in terrible condition looking like it was opened. See picture. Sending back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: k0nj02

customer_reviews.title: OverHeats And Card Is Extremely Bent After 8 Months Of Usage
customer_reviews.text: Had This Card Since January Noticed Recently That The Pcb Is Extremely Bent And Its Been Getting Well Over 85c In Games May Have To Return This And Get A Different Card Its Good For The Money But Longevity Wise It Isn't Great
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Quilter

customer_reviews.title: runs like a charm
customer_reviews.text: this graphics card is honestly good price for what you get, it runs any game i can throw at it with complete ease
customer_reviews.author: keenan simpson

customer_reviews.title: Raytracing is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful video card and raytracing is amazing. Also very good for VR Good upgrade from my 1080 Call of duty looks outstanding with raytracing
customer_reviews.author: jonny

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Great card so far, smashing every game I've thrown at it on ultra!
customer_reviews.author: rowan harris

customer_reviews.title: so splendid. Nvidia outdid themselves here
customer_reviews.text: absolutely spectacular. now I can get 800FPS on Minecraft and framerate drops are nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: Great card, such a good buy, great value for money, and works superb. Fans at full power can be a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jarjar

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a card
customer_reviews.text: Can be loud when maxed but never gets more than 70°c bargain for 4k on maxed settings at 60fps
customer_reviews.author: Bighairy

customer_reviews.title: Monster for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far this GPU has been amazing. I have managed to play every game on max settings with very high FPS. As with most GPUs very easy to install and drivers also easy to install. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: It just works - Todd Howard
customer_reviews.text: For me the thing boosts to just under 2000mhz which is great. very good card
customer_reviews.author: Nep Nep

customer_reviews.title: Great frames, terrible noise.
customer_reviews.text: Great card, provides fantastic frames and easy to install. Downside is that it is very loud when gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Hunt

customer_reviews.title: 4K monitor rlly makes it shine
customer_reviews.text: Set easy to Install not to loud good quality game would recommend a 4K monitor with it 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Brunton

customer_reviews.title: It's a huge step up from what I had previously
customer_reviews.text: As this is not a verified purchase, I do own this card and I purchased it from Scan because at the time Amazon were out of stock. It runs like a dream. It's quiet, its powerful, the idle temps are exceptionally low, and during intense gameplay I never hit above 70c. Definitely worth your purchase if you're thinking of upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: matt

product_meta.title: MSI NVIDIA GEFORCE RTX 2070 SUPER VENTUS OC Graphics Card '8GB GDDR6, 1785MHz, 3x DisplayPort, HDMI, Dual Fan Cooling System'
product_meta.description: The NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 SUPER is powered by the award-winning NVIDIA Turing architecture and has a superfast GPU with more cores and faster clocks to unleash your creative productivity and gaming dominance. It’s time to gear up and get super powers. NVIDIA Turing—the world’s most advanced GPU architecture—fuses next-generation shaders with real-time ray tracing and all-new AI capabilities. This new hybrid graphics capability represents the biggest generational leap ever in gaming GPUs, delivering up to 6X more performance than previous 10 Series NVIDIA Pascal GPUs.
feature_bullets: Boost Clock / Memory Speed : up to 1785 MHz / 14 Gbps / 8 GB GDDR6
TORX Fan 2.0 with Double Ball Bearings; dispersion fan blade : steep curved blade accelerating the airflow
NVIDIA G-SYNC and HDR : get smooth, tear-free gameplay at refresh rates up to 240 Hz, plus HDR, and more
GeForce RTX VR : by combining advanced VR rendering, real-time ray tracing, and AI, GeForce RTX will take VR to a new level of realism

specifications.Series: MSI Nvidia RTX2070 Super Ventus OC 8GB Fan GDDR6 DP/HDMI PCI Express Graphics Card
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars207 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
